newsitem.title: UK: STOCKS - Closing stock market indices, Feb 21.
newsitem.headline: STOCKS - Closing stock market indices, Feb 21.

text.p: Here is how major stock markets outside the United States ended on Friday.

LONDON - London's FTSE 100 share index finished the week close to where it began after weakness on Wall Street and an unwinding of options positions sent it trundling lower on Friday. Modest Dow gains lifted the FTSE off its lows in the afternoon but it still ended 19.3 points lower at 4,336.8 down 4.2 fom a week ago.

FRANKFURT - German shares mostly tread water in bourse trade on Friday at lower levels, with sentiment muted by lower, albeit stable, dollar and overnight weakness on Wall Street. Market jitters in advance of options expiry and softer German debt also impact, dealers talk of wholesale selling. Talk of imminent correction. The DAX-30 index ended at 3,184.09, up 11.94 points down 64.09 since last week. In post-bourse trade the index stood at 3,203.79 up 6.70.

PARIS - French stocks finished the week with a third day of measured consolidation on Friday after a run of record-setting sessions. The blue-chip CAC-40 index ended down 12.40 points or 0.48 percent at 2562.84 a drop of 64.58 on the week.

ZURICH - Swiss shares ended slightly lower in a consolidation of recent gains while market interest focused on UBS and on the expiry of options and futures. The All-share Swiss Performance Index (SPI) lost 4.01 points, or 0.14 percent, to end at 2,871.18 up 31.75 since a week ago.

TOKYO - Tokyo stocks ended flat on Friday after the market benchmark wandered in both negative and positive ranges for most of the day. The Nikkei 225 clawed back above the 19,000 line to close down 17.17 points or 0.09 percent at 19,034.54 a rise of 312.54 from last Friday.

HONG KONG - Calm was restored to the Hong Kong stock market on Friday following Thursday's dramatic surge and shares overcame profit-taking pressures to finish higher. The Hang Seng Index rose 33.52 points, or 0.25 percent, to close at 13,444.85 up 331.59 from a week ago.

SYDNEY - The Australian share market closed barely changed on Friday after early Wall Street-induced selling in the banks petered out and support for the major miners emerged at the day's lows. The All Ordinaries index ended one point lower at 2,475.3 a fall of 7.3 on the week.

JOHANNESBURG - South African gold shares robust towards Friday's close on firmer bullion price. Seen continuing strong on Monday if bullion price holds. Industrials drift weak amid profit-taking and weighed down by Dow Jones's overnight drop. Market players seen taking cue from Wall Street and gold price for direction on Monday. Gold index jumps 46.9 points to 1,517.8 up 122.7 from last Friday, helping to push overall share index 21.5 points up to 7,124.1. This was 103.4 up on last week. Industrials shed 12.4 points to 8,379.3 a gain of 74 from a week ago.
